description: Creates a product. A delegated admin is authorized to invoke this command. The user or role that performs this operation must have the cloudformation:GetTemplate IAM policy permission. This policy permission is required when using the ImportFromPhysicalId template source in the information data section.

parameters.name: AcceptLanguage
parameters.description: The language code. jp - Japanese zh - Chinese.

parameters.name: SupportUrl
parameters.description: The contact URL for product support. ``^https?:/// ``/ is the pattern used to validate SupportUrl.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: One or more tags. (dict) --- Information about a tag. A tag is a key-value pair. Tags are propagated to the resources created when provisioning a product. The tag key. The value for this key.

parameters.name: ProvisioningArtifactParameters
parameters.description: The configuration of the provisioning artifact. Name (string) --- The name of the provisioning artifact (for example, v1 v2beta). No spaces are allowed. Description (string) --- The description of the provisioning artifact, including how it differs from the previous provisioning artifact. Info (dict) --- Specify the template source with one of the following options, but not both. Keys accepted: [ LoadTemplateFromURL, ImportFromPhysicalId ] The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3 or GitHub in JSON format. Specify the URL in JSON format as follows: "LoadTemplateFromURL": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-ozkq9d3hgiq2-us-east-1/..." ImportFromPhysicalId: The physical id of the resource that contains the template. Currently only supports CloudFormation stack arn. Specify the physical id in JSON format as follows: ImportFromPhysicalId: 'arn:aws:cloudformation:[us-east-1]:[accountId]:stack/[StackName]/[resourceId] (string) --- (string) --- Type (string) --- The type of provisioning artifact. CLOUD_FORMATION_TEMPLATE - CloudFormation template TERRAFORM_OPEN_SOURCE - Terraform Open Source configuration file TERRAFORM_CLOUD - Terraform Cloud configuration file EXTERNAL - External configuration file DisableTemplateValidation (boolean) --- If set to true, Service Catalog stops validating the specified provisioning artifact even if it is invalid. Service Catalog does not support template validation for the TERRAFORM_OS product type.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the provisioning artifact (for example, v1 v2beta). No spaces are allowed.

nested_params.name: Description
nested_params.description: The description of the provisioning artifact, including how it differs from the previous provisioning artifact.

nested_params.name: Info
nested_params.description: Specify the template source with one of the following options, but not both. Keys accepted: [ LoadTemplateFromURL, ImportFromPhysicalId ] The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3 or GitHub in JSON format. Specify the URL in JSON format as follows: "LoadTemplateFromURL": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-ozkq9d3hgiq2-us-east-1/..." ImportFromPhysicalId: The physical id of the resource that contains the template. Currently only supports CloudFormation stack arn. Specify the physical id in JSON format as follows: ImportFromPhysicalId: 'arn:aws:cloudformation:[us-east-1]:[accountId]:stack/[StackName]/[resourceId]

nested_params.name: DisableTemplateValidation
nested_params.description: If set to true, Service Catalog stops validating the specified provisioning artifact even if it is invalid. Service Catalog does not support template validation for the TERRAFORM_OS product type.

parameters.name: IdempotencyToken
parameters.description: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: SourceConnection
parameters.description: Specifies connection details for the created product and syncs the product to the connection source artifact. This automatically manages the product's artifacts based on changes to the source. The SourceConnection parameter consists of the following sub-fields. Type ConnectionParamters Type (string) --- The only supported SourceConnection type is Codestar. The connection details based on the connection Type. CodeStar (dict) --- Provides ConnectionType details. The CodeStar ARN, which is the connection between Service Catalog and the external repository. The specific repository where the product's artifact-to-be-synced resides, formatted as 'Account/Repo.' The specific branch where the artifact resides. The absolute path wehre the artifact resides within the repo and branch, formatted as 'folder/file.json.'

nested_items.name: ProductViewDetail
nested_items.description: Information about the product view.

nested_items.name: ProductViewSummary
nested_items.description: Summary information about the product view.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The product view identifier.

nested_items.name: ProductId
nested_items.description: The product identifier.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the product.

nested_items.name: Owner
nested_items.description: The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value.

nested_items.name: ShortDescription
nested_items.description: Short description of the product.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The product type. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value. If this value is MARKETPLACE, the product was created by Amazon Web Services Marketplace.

nested_items.name: Distributor
nested_items.description: The distributor of the product. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value.

nested_items.name: HasDefaultPath
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the product has a default path. If the product does not have a default path, call  ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between paths. Otherwise,  ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of  ProductViewSummary can be used directly with  DescribeProvisioningParameters.

nested_items.name: SupportEmail
nested_items.description: The email contact information to obtain support for this Product.

nested_items.name: SupportDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the support for this Product.

nested_items.name: SupportUrl
nested_items.description: The URL information to obtain support for this Product.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the product.
AVAILABLE - The product is ready for use.
CREATING - Product creation has started; the product is not ready for use.
FAILED - An action failed.

nested_items.name: ProductARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the product.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

nested_items.name: SourceConnection
nested_items.description: A top level ProductViewDetail response containing details about the product's connection. Service Catalog returns this field for the CreateProduct, UpdateProduct, DescribeProductAsAdmin, and SearchProductAsAdmin APIs. This response contains the same fields as the ConnectionParameters request, with the addition of the LastSync response.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The only supported SourceConnection type is Codestar.

nested_items.name: ConnectionParameters
nested_items.description: The connection details based on the connection Type.

nested_items.name: ConnectionArn
nested_items.description: The CodeStar ARN, which is the connection between Service Catalog and the external repository.

nested_items.name: Repository
nested_items.description: The specific repository where the product's artifact-to-be-synced resides, formatted as 'Account/Repo.'

nested_items.name: Branch
nested_items.description: The specific branch where the artifact resides.

nested_items.name: ArtifactPath
nested_items.description: The absolute path wehre the artifact resides within the repo and branch, formatted as 'folder/file.json.'
LastSyncTime.
LastSyncStatus.
LastSyncStatusMessage.
LastSuccessfulSyncTime.
LastSuccessfulSyncProvisioningArtifactID.

nested_items.name: ProvisioningArtifactDetail
nested_items.description: Information about the provisioning artifact.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the provisioning artifact.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the provisioning artifact.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the provisioning artifact.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of provisioning artifact.
CLOUD_FORMATION_TEMPLATE - CloudFormation template.
TERRAFORM_OPEN_SOURCE - Terraform Open Source configuration file.
TERRAFORM_CLOUD - Terraform Cloud configuration file.
EXTERNAL - External configuration file.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

nested_items.name: Active
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the product version is active.

nested_items.name: Guidance
nested_items.description: Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users about which provisioning artifacts to use.

nested_items.name: SourceRevision
nested_items.description: Specifies the revision of the external artifact that was used to automatically sync the Service Catalog product and create the provisioning artifact. Service Catalog includes this response parameter as a high level field to the existing ProvisioningArtifactDetail type, which is returned as part of the response for CreateProduct, UpdateProduct, DescribeProductAsAdmin, DescribeProvisioningArtifact, ListProvisioningArtifact, and UpdateProvisioningArticat APIs.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Information about the tags associated with the product.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The tag key.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for this key.
